categories.name: Mammals
categories.description: Animals that typically have fur or hair, give birth to live young, and nurse their offspring with milk.

categories.name: Amphibians
categories.description: Cold-blooded vertebrates that usually lay eggs in water and undergo metamorphosis from aquatic larvae to terrestrial adults.

categories.name: Reptiles
categories.description: Cold-blooded vertebrates characterized by scales, laying eggs on land, and having a lung-based respiratory system.

categories.name: Birds
categories.description: Warm-blooded vertebrates with feathers, beaks, and lay hard-shelled eggs. They are known for their ability to fly.

categories.name: Cats
categories.description: Small carnivorous mammals known for their retractable claws, sharp teeth, and agility. They are popular as pets.

categories.name: Insects
categories.description: Small invertebrates with six legs and typically one or two pairs of wings. They undergo metamorphosis and play vital roles in ecosystems.

categories.name: Fish
categories.description: Aquatic vertebrates with gills, fins, and scales. They breathe through gills and are adapted to life in water.

animals.name: African Elephant
animals.description: The African elephant is the largest land animal on Earth. They are known for their long tusks and distinctive trunk.

animals.name: Bengal Tiger
animals.description: The Bengal tiger is the most numerous tiger subspecies. They are known for their orange fur with black stripes and powerful build.

animals.name: Snow Leopard
animals.habitat: Mountain ranges of Central and South Asia
animals.description: The snow leopard is a large cat native to the mountain ranges of Central and South Asia. It is characterized by its thick fur and spotted coat.

animals.name: Giant Panda
animals.description: The giant panda is a bear native to China. It is known for its distinctive black and white coat and its diet primarily consisting of bamboo.

animals.name: Gorilla
animals.description: Gorillas are the largest living primates. They are ground-dwelling and primarily herbivorous.

animals.name: Red Kangaroo
animals.description: The red kangaroo is the largest kangaroo species. It is known for its distinctive red fur and powerful hind legs, which allow it to hop long distances.

animals.name: Polar Bear
animals.description: The polar bear is a large bear native to the Arctic. It is superbly adapted to its icy habitat with thick fur and a layer of fat for insulation.

animals.name: Komodo Dragon
animals.habitat: Indonesian islands of Komodo, Rinca, Flores, and Gili Motang
animals.description: The Komodo dragon is the world's largest lizard. It is a fierce predator with a venomous bite and can be found in the Indonesian islands.

animals.name: Blue Whale
animals.description: The blue whale is the largest animal on Earth. They are marine mammals and feed primarily on krill. They are known for their immense size and distinctive blue-gray color.

animals.name: African Lion
animals.description: The African lion is a large carnivorous cat known for its mane. It is a keystone species in its ecosystem, playing a crucial role in maintaining the balance of the African savanna.

animals.name: Amazon Rainforest Frog
animals.description: The Amazon Rainforest Frog, also known as poison dart frogs, are small colorful frogs native to the Amazon Rainforest. Some species possess toxins used by indigenous tribes for hunting.

animals.name: Siberian Tiger
animals.habitat: Russian Far East, Northeast China, and possibly North Korea
animals.description: The Siberian Tiger, also known as the Amur Tiger, is the largest cat species and primarily found in the forests of eastern Russia. Poaching and habitat loss are the main threats to its survival.

animals.name: Galapagos Giant Tortoise
animals.description: The Galapagos Giant Tortoise is one of the largest tortoise species in the world. They are native to the Galapagos Islands and are known for their long lifespans, sometimes exceeding 100 years.

animals.name: Bald Eagle
animals.description: The Bald Eagle is a bird of prey found in North America, primarily near large bodies of open water. It is the national bird and symbol of the United States.

animals.name: Pangolin
animals.description: Pangolins are unique mammals covered in protective keratin scales. They are often poached for their scales, which are used in traditional Chinese medicine.

animals.name: Sloth
animals.description: Sloths are slow-moving mammals found in the rainforests of Central and South America. They spend most of their time hanging upside down from trees.

animals.name: Panda Ant
animals.description: The Panda Ant is a species of wingless wasp found in South America. Its black and white coloration resembles that of a panda, hence its name.

animals.name: Australian Platypus
animals.description: The Australian Platypus is a unique mammal that lays eggs and is native to eastern Australia. It has a duck-like bill, webbed feet, and a beaver-like tail.

animals.name: Green Sea Turtle
animals.description: The Green Sea Turtle is one of the largest sea turtles and is found in tropical and subtropical oceans worldwide. They are herbivores, feeding on seagrasses and algae.

animals.name: Reticulated Python
animals.description: The Reticulated Python is one of the largest snake species and is found in the jungles and forests of Southeast Asia. It is known for its beautifully patterned scales.

animals.name: Golden Lion Tamarin
animals.description: The Golden Lion Tamarin is a small monkey with a striking golden mane. It is native to the Atlantic coastal forests of Brazil and is critically endangered due to habitat loss.

animals.name: Quetzal
animals.description: The Quetzal is a colorful bird native to the cloud forests of Central America. It is known for its vibrant plumage and long tail feathers.

animals.name: Coelacanth
animals.description: The Coelacanth is a prehistoric fish that was thought to be extinct until it was rediscovered in the 20th century. It inhabits deep underwater caves.

animals.name: Axolotl
animals.description: The Axolotl is a unique salamander known for its regenerative abilities. It is native to the Xochimilco lake complex in Mexico and is critically endangered.

animals.name: Serval
animals.description: The Serval is a medium-sized wild cat native to the grasslands of Africa. It is known for its long legs, which help it hunt in tall grass.

animals.name: Sunda Flying Lemur
animals.description: The Sunda Flying Lemur, also known as the Sunda Colugo, is not a lemur and cannot fly. It is a gliding mammal native to the forests of Southeast Asia.

animals.name: Giant Otter
animals.description: The Giant Otter is a large otter species native to South America. It is known for its long body, dense fur, and social behavior.

animals.name: African Wild Dog
animals.description: The African Wild Dog, also known as the painted wolf, is a highly social carnivore native to sub-Saharan Africa. It is endangered due to habitat loss and human conflict.

animals.name: Red Panda
animals.description: The Red Panda is a small arboreal mammal native to the eastern Himalayas and southwestern China. It is known for its distinctive red fur and bushy tail.

animals.name: Monarch Butterfly
animals.description: The Monarch Butterfly is known for its distinctive orange and black wings. It is famous for its long-distance seasonal migration in North America.

animals.name: Cheetah
animals.habitat: Savannas of Africa and parts of Iran
animals.description: The cheetah is the fastest land animal, capable of reaching speeds up to 70 mph in short bursts. It is found in the savannas of Africa and parts of Iran.

animals.name: Mountain Gorilla
animals.description: The mountain gorilla is a subspecies of the eastern gorilla found in the mountain forests of Africa. It is one of the most endangered apes in the world.
